intro: Pavetta supra-axillaris, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. The flowers bloom throughout the year, making it a valuable ornamental and potential medicinal plant.
